body: Good day @cenomla! Could you please also provide the distribution, desktop environment & window manager, in question? I'll try to reproduce the issues you mentioned, so we can debug what is wrong. Going to try reproducing this on Fedora 24 (GNOME and Mutter) since they can also run on Wayland, but it would be best to have your exact setup, since this could be exclusive to only a subset of setups.
I could reproduce using tests/events.c on Weston master (1.11.90 revision 0da12b8) on ArchLinux, and the issue comes from src/wl_init.c:297 being executed no matter which action it is.

Alright, I've also tested this on `Fedora 24 Workstation` with `GNOME 3.20` with `Mutter 3.20` using their experimental `gnome-shell --wayland` compositor. Just as @linkmauve, I can reproduce these issues.

I'm using ArchLinux with Gnome 3.20 and a wayland session. This only seems to happen when glfw is using the wayland platform. When I compile glfw using X11 and run it using xwayland this does not happen.

issue.title: Only input a character on GLFW_PRESS action

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Bug reports and bugfix pull requests

repository.name: glfw
repository.description: A multi-platform library for OpenGL, OpenGL ES, Vulkan, window and input

body: Hi, sorry for the delay, I just proposed a fix which I only tested on Weston against tests/events, please check against your compositor and application.
Looks fine to me. It'd read clearer if the code that does _glfwInputChar() in its own function and then do if (action == GLFW_PRESS) input_char(...); but either way will work.
I can confirm that this fix works.
jadahl, this is a good suggestion, it makes the code more obvious in what it does, I force-pushed this.
